intro: Anredera cordifolia, commonly known as heartleaf arum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. It belongs to the Araceae family, which includes other familiar plants like philodendrons and calla lilies. Anredera cordifolia is sometimes considered an invasive species in regions outside its native range.
